awd_titl_txt: Modification of Heat Transfer Characteristics of            Turbulent Boundary Layers by Large-Eddy Breakup             Devices
awd_abstract_narration: Large-eddy breakup devices have been shown to reduce substantially the          viscous drag in turbulent boundary layers.  This study investigates the         modification of the heat transfer characteristics of turbulent boundary         layers by such devices.  Both averaged and instantaneous measurements           of the heat transfer will be performed.  The measurements will be               obtained by a two-dimensional array of sub-miniature thermocouples, and         will allow the determination of the instantaneous spatial thermal field         and its evolution in time.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems
